      • getRenderPass

        public int getRenderPass()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Returns a flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for. The returned value should be the bitwise-OR of any of the following flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Specified by:
        getRenderPass in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Returns:
        A flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for

      • draw

        public void draw​(GLMapView view,
                 int pass)
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable2.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Overrides:
        draw in class GLAsynchronousLayer2<com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams>
        Parameters:
        view - The current view
        pass - The render pass being executed during this invocation. The value will be the bitwise-OR of any of the flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Only content valid for the specified pass should be rendered.

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: GLLayer2
        Transitions the layer renderer into the Started state. The renderer may only access its subject while in the Started state.

        This method may be invoked from any thread, however, it may never be called concurrently with GLLayer2.stop().

        Specified by:
        start in interface GLLayer2
        Overrides:
        start in class GLAsynchronousLayer2<com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams>

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: GLLayer2
        Transitions the layer renderer into the Stopped state. The renderer may not access its subject until returning to the Started state, however, any renderable content previously derived may continue to be rendered.

        This method may be invoked from any thread, however, it may never be called concurrently with GLLayer2.start().

        Specified by:
        stop in interface GLLayer2
        Overrides:
        stop in class GLAsynchronousLayer2<com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams>

        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Returns the Collection containing the renderables associated with the current GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.preparedState.

        This method should only ever be invoked in #draw(GLMapView) while holding the lock on this. References to the Collection or any of its elements should not be held outside of that method.

      • createPendingData

        protected com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams createPendingData()
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Creates the pending data object. This object will store the result of the asynchronous query such that the renderable and release lists can subsequently be constructed via the invocation of #updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object).

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner.

        Specified by:
        createPendingData in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams>
        Returns:
        The object to hold the query result

      • updateRenderList

        protected boolean updateRenderList​(GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.ViewState state,
                                   com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams pendingData)
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Constructs the render list based on the supplied query result.

        This method will be invoked on the worker thread in an unsynchronized manner. It is STRONGLY that this method not be synchronized in a manner that it may block any of the other methods that are synchronized on this as this may serious degrade rendering performance.

        Specified by:
        updateRenderList in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams>
        Parameters:
        state - The state that produced the results
        pendingData - The result of the query
        Returns:
        true if the renderable and release lists were brought into sync with the current GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.targetState, false otherwise. If this method returns true, GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.preparedState will take on the state of GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.targetState and the worker will remain idle until GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.checkState() returns false.

      • query

        protected void query​(GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2.ViewState state,
                     com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams result)
        Description copied from class: GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2
        Performs a query based on the specified target state. The results of the query will be used to create valid render and release lists via #updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object).

        This method will only be invoked on the worker thread and its invocation will not be externally synchronized. Synchronization of the query itself on this is strongly discouraged as doing so will effectively block #draw(GLMapView).

        Specified by:
        query in class GLAsynchronousMapRenderable2<com.atakmap.android.offscreenindicators.graphics.OffscreenIndicatorParams>
        Parameters:
        state - The state to query against
        result - Stores the result of the query. The pending data will subsquently be passed to #updateRenderableReleaseLists(Object).

      • computeHaloPoint

        public static void computeHaloPoint​(android.graphics.PointF screenPoint,
                                    android.graphics.RectF haloBorder)
        Given a "halo" (inset boundary around screen), update the point location such that it is located on the "halo" boundary closest to the original location.
        Parameters:
        screenPoint - A point, in screenspace
        haloBorder - The halo boundary, in screenspace. Note that haloRect.top should correspond to the least y-value for the boundary and haloRect.top should correspond to the greatest y-value for the boundary, regardless of the coordinate system's origin.

      • shouldDraw

        public static boolean shouldDraw​(Marker m,
                                 GeoPoint focusPoint,
                                 double distanceThreshold,
                                 long timeout)

      • shouldDraw

        public static boolean shouldDraw​(Marker m,
                                 float x,
                                 float y,
                                 float screenWidth,
                                 float screenHeight,
                                 GeoPoint focusPoint,
                                 double distanceThreshold)

      • shouldDraw

        public static boolean shouldDraw​(Marker m,
                                 float x,
                                 float y,
                                 float screenWidth,
                                 float screenHeight,
                                 GeoPoint focusPoint,
                                 double distanceThreshold,
                                 long timeout)
        Returns true if an offscreen indicator should be drawn for the specified Marker, false otherwise.

        Note: the timeout related checks inspect metadata on the marker, making this test more expensive. If the test is being performed in a context where the marker previously passed a call to shouldDraw with a valid timeout value, the more expensive test may be skipped.

        Parameters:
        m - The marker
        x - The screenspace x location of the marker, respecting origin
        y - The screenspace y location of the marker, respecting origin
        screenWidth - The width of the screen
        screenHeight - The height of the screen
        focusPoint - The current focus point of the scene
        distanceThreshold - The distance threshold between the m and focusPoint past which the marker is no longer considered eligible as an offscreen indicator
        timeout - The offscreen indicator timeout, in milliseconds. Less than zero to skip timeout tests.
        Returns:
